articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Cuban Ambassador
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Cuban Ambassador
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Jesus de los Angeles Aise Sotolongo, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall, on Monday.

articles.title: Vietnamese Ambassador and Military Attache Give Reception
articles.content:
Vietnamese Ambassador and Military Attache Give Reception
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Pham Huu Giao, Vietnamese charge d'affaires ad interim to the DPRK, and Nguyen Quoc Viet, military attache of the Vietnamese embassy here, gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club Monday on the occasion of the army day of Vietnam.
					 Present there on invitation were No Kwang Chol, first vice minister of the People's Armed Forces, generals and officers of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys and military attaches of embassies of different countries here.

articles.title: DPRK Skaters Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Skaters Back Home
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK skaters came back home on Sunday after taking part in the Asian Open Short-track Speed Skating Trophy 2015 which took place in the Philippines on December 16 and 17.
					 The games brought together men and women skaters from 11 countries and regions.
					
					Jong Il Nam placed first at the 500m and 1,000m games in juvenile category I, bagging two gold medals. He placed second at the 1,500m game.
					
					 Jong Kwang Bom placed second at the 500m and 1,000m games in juvenile category II and third at the 333m game. Kim Un Hyok finished runner-up at the 333m game and placed third at the 500m game.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Evil Habit of Escalating Confrontation Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Evil Habit of Escalating Confrontation Denounced 
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The breakdown of the north-south authorities' talks is the inevitable result of the south Korean authorities' chronic evil habit of escalating confrontation, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in an article. 
					 The recent breakdown proved that the south Korean authorities do not have an iota of the will to break with the inglorious past and make a switchover in its one-sided confrontation-minded "north policy", the article says, and goes on:
					
					 Now the south Korean authorities are desperately trying to escape from the responsibility for the failure of the above-said talks. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities are gravely mistaken if they think they can deceive the public opinion and cover up their nature as the disturber of dialogue and improvement of the inter-Korean relations with foolish rubbish. 
					
					 They should stop such an awkward wordplay but reflect on their crime of breaking down the hard-won north-south authorities' talks before vociferating about someone's "responsibility". 
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that the north-south relations will go to a catastrophe due to the south Korean authorities' vicious moves. 
					
					 The present situation shows that the south Korean authorities' chronic bad habit of escalating confrontation would only bring bankruptcy of the north-south relations.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S., S. Korea of Justifying Illegal Introduction of Anthrax
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S., S. Korea of Justifying Illegal Introduction of Anthrax
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Days ago, the south Korea-U.S. joint group opened to public the result of the joint investigation into the illegal introduction of live anthrax into south Korea by the U.S.
					 The result showed that the U.S. forces in south Korea have conducted experiments and drills since 2009 after introducing the anthrax samples in top secrecy.
					
					 It is over ten times that anthrax was brought to the U.S. military base in Ryongsan over the past six years till the last year. It was later revealed that anthrax samples as well as pest samples were sent to the U.S. air force base in Osan in April.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a commentary that this brings to light the criminal plan of the U.S. and south Korean authorities to plunge the Korean nation into the disastrous germ warfare in wanton violation of international law. It goes on:
					
					 What is more intolerable is that during the investigation the U.S. and south Korean authorities floated groundless rumors that the north might "use anthrax and pest germs in terrorist acts and an all-out war," and agreed to "boost cooperation in coping with biological weapons." This is the manifestation of a dangerous scheme to justify their illegal introduction of anthrax and translate into reality their ambition for invading the north by using germ weapons in contingency under the pretext of non-existent "threat of biological weapons from the north".
					
					 They should never be allowed to justify their criminal acts and calm down the public indignation by glossing over the illegal introduction of anthrax and floating rumors.

articles.title: U.S. Forces Slammed for Concealing Anthrax Experiments in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Forces Slammed for Concealing Anthrax Experiments in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggressor forces were disclosed to have concealed the experiments on germ weapons which they conducted in south Korea. This has touched off the public indignation.
					 A joint group for investigating the illegal introduction of anthrax by the U.S. forces into south Korea disclosed on Dec. 17 that they conducted experiments on germ weapons in the U.S. military base in Ryongsan 15 times from 2009 to 2014 after introducing the anthrax samples.
					
					 The tests were carried out at the hospital inside the base.
					
					 It was also disclosed that a U.S. institute sent pest samples together with anthrax samples to the U.S. air force base in Osan.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Denounce U.S. Forces' Germ Weapons Experiments
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Denounce U.S. Forces' Germ Weapons Experiments
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and other civic and public organizations of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on December 18 to condemn the atrocity of the U.S. forces, according to the south Korean KBS and CBS.
					 The organizations said it has been disclosed that the U.S. forces carried out 15 germ weapons experiments from 2009 to 2014 after introducing anthrax samples into the U.S. military base in Ryongsan and even conducted experiments on pest germ.
					
					 They demanded the U.S. forces withdraw the offensive biological war strategy and doctrine targeting the north and stop at once the U.S.-south Korea joint war maneuvers aimed at germ warfare.
					
					 On the same day the south Korean Council of Christian Churches released a similar statement.
					
					 It stressed that the U.S. government has to make an official apology before the south Korean people and punish the persons responsible.

articles.title: S. Korean FM's Provocative Remarks against DPRK Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean FM's Provocative Remarks against DPRK Flailed
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- South Korean Foreign Minister Yun Pyong Se made a string of talks about "dialogue" to cover his vicious intention.
					 At a plenary meeting of the political advisory board of the Foreign Ministry on Dec. 17, Yun talked about "strategic provocation" by the north, according to a south Korean newspaper.
					
					 He even claimed that it is necessary to direct more efforts to the deterrence diplomacy through cooperation with the U.S. and neighboring countries while keeping a close watch on the tendency of the north and, make efforts to lead it to the dialogue for denuclearization.
					
					 His invectives are a blatant challenge and an unpardonable provocation against the DPRK making sincere efforts for dialogue.
					
					 The south Korean conservative authorities can never evade the blame for derailing the inter-Korean dialogue and marring the climate for the improvement of the relations.

articles.title: S. Korean Ruling Forces Accused of Working Hard to Railroad Evil Bills against People's Living
articles.content:
S. Korean Ruling Forces Accused of Working Hard to Railroad Evil Bills against People's Living
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative ruling quarters are getting desperate in their moves to railroad evil bills against people's living through the "National Assembly" (NA).
					 The present chief executive expressed discontent with the failure of the passage of the bill on labor reform, bill on economy, bill against terrorism, etc. through the NA.
					
					 The said bills are known as the ones against people's living as they are peppered with contents meeting the purpose of the one percent privileged and conglomerates but ruthlessly trampling down the vital rights of the overwhelming majority of people, according to mass media.
					
					 The present chief executive at a meeting on Dec. 16 pressurized the NA to handle the above-said bills without delay, crying out for "political reform" and "vital economy" despite unanimous condemnation by the people from all walks of life and the ruling and opposition parties.
					
					 On Dec. 15 the chief secretary for state affairs of Chongwadae forced the NA speaker to pass the bills by taking advantage of his authority before the bills related to the upcoming general elections are brought to the NA up for discussion.

articles.title: 3rd All-out People's Action Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
3rd All-out People's Action Launched in S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The third all-out people's action attended by more than 20 000 people has been launched in 13 regions of south Korea on December 19 in denunciation of the unpopular policy of the south Korean authorities. 
					 There took place a rally at Kwanghwamun Plaza in Seoul. 
					
					 Pak Sok Un, permanent co-representative of the People's Strength, said that the history is fairly estimated no matter how desperately the present regime eulogizes pro-Japanese policy and dictatorship. 
					
					 Choe Jong Jin, chief vice-chairman of the Confederation of Trade Unions, stressed the need to punish the present regime which is trying to railroad the bill on labor through the "National Assembly" within this year at any cost, even talking about state of emergency. 
					
					 Then the participants made a demonstration march. 
					
					 Members of civic and public organizations, workers and peasants in South Kyongsang Province turned out in the third all-out people's action in Changwon City of the province on the same day. 
					
					 There simultaneously took place demos and information services for the punishment of the regime against the retrogressive revision of the labor law in different parts of south Korea.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Pay Floral Tribute to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Pay Floral Tribute to Kim Jong Il
 Tokyo, December 19 (KNS-KCNA) -- A floral basket was presented with due ceremony before the portrait of smiling leader Kim Jong Il at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on Dec. 17, the 4th anniversary of his demise.
					 Present at the ceremony were Ho Jong Man, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, officials of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan and other Chongryon organizations and officials of Chongryon headquarters, branches, bodies and enterprises across Japan.
					
					 They laid a floral basket and bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il before paying homage to him.

articles.title: Film Show Held by Chongryon
articles.content:
Film Show Held by Chongryon
 Tokyo, December 18 (KNS-KCNA) -- A film show of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) took place at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on Dec. 17, the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The participants watched a Korean film dealing with his revolutionary career.
					
					 They looked backed on the exploits of Kim Jong Il, great revolutionary and peerless patriot, who dedicated his all to the country and people all his life.
					
					 Among the audience were Ho Jong Man, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, its vice-chairpersons, the chairman of the Central Audit Committee of Chongryon and its department directors, the permanent advisor and the director of the Research Institute on History of Korean Residents in Japan and officials.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" was published in booklet by the Nakhodka Format Publishing House of Russia on December 15.
					 The work, published on August 25, Juche 102 (2013), deals with leader Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary leadership exploits, the essence and originality of the Songun revolutionary idea and tasks for successfully accomplishing the cause of Songun revolution.

articles.title: Kimilsungia Greenhouse Visited by Guinean People
articles.content:
Kimilsungia Greenhouse Visited by Guinean People
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Ceremonies of visiting the Kimilsungia greenhouse took place in Conakry, Guinea from December 10 to 17 under the sponsorship of the Guinean committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed at the greenhouse were photos dealing with the immortal revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed were scores of potted Kimilsungias presenting charming scenery and photos dealing with the struggle of the service personnel and people of the DPRK dynamically stepping up the building of a thriving nation under the banner of Songun.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were personages of the Guinean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Society, the Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry and those in Koloma District of the city and other people.
					
					 The secretary general of the Guinean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association said that leader Kim Jong Il firmly defended the dignity and sovereignty of the country and the nation with the Songun politics and performed immortal exploits for the cause of global independence.
					
					 He stressed the need to intensify the activities to widely introduce the greatness and immortal exploits of the peerlessly great men.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Guinean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association said that Kimilsungias and Kimjongilias came into being thanks to the deep reverence of all people for the peerlessly great men.
					
					 He stressed that it is natural that Guinean people are charmed by the deep meaning and beauty of the famous flower.
					
					 After the ceremony the participants went round the Kimilsungia greenhouse.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Swiss Organizations
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on Dec. 12 on the occasion of the 24th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Entering the 1990s the U.S. imperialists and their followers got more frantic in their moves to stifle socialist Korea.
					
					 Generalissimo Kim Jong Il pursued the original Songun politics guided by the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The DPRK has further strengthened and proudly ranked itself among satellite manufacturing and launching states and nuclear weapons states thanks to his Songun politics.
					
					 Kim Jong Il provided two north-south summits and made sure that the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration, its practical programme, were adopted to realize the historic cause of national reunification.
					
					 He opened up the road for the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and successfully applied the three charters for national reunification advanced by Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Demise Anniversary Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Demise Anniversary Observed Abroad
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries on Dec. 10 and 11 on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They included a remembrance meeting, photo and book exhibition and film show held in London under the co-sponsorship of the British committee for remembering Comrade Kim Jong Il and the Coordinating Committee of the British Friends of the DPRK.
					
					 Displayed at the venue of the event were photos dealing with the exploits of the great leaders.
					
					 On display there were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and books and photos introducing the Korean people in their struggle for building a thriving nation.
					
					 Participants of the film show watched the Korean film dealing with the exploits of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They laid a floral basket before the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist), the chairman of the Korean Friendship Association UK and other speakers lauded Kim Jong Il for upholding the banner of Songun to resolutely smash the imperialists' moves for stifling the DPRK, defend socialist Korea and usher in the new era of building a thriving nation.
					
					 They praised Kim Jong Il as a distinguished thinker and theoretician who proved the scientific accuracy and truth of socialism and a peerless statesman who turned the DPRK into a socialist power.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting. 
					
					 Meanwhile, remembrance meetings were held in Kuwait and Indonesia.

articles.title: Korean Film Shows Held in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Korean Film Shows Held in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Korean film shows took place in Thailand, Nigeria and Algeria from Dec. 12 to 15 on the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The films shown included Korean films "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation" and "Masikryong Ski Resort".

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador cubano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador cubano
Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- A Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, le presento el dia 21 Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica de Cuba en la RPDC
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Ofrecido banquete con motivo del Dia del Ejercito de Vietnam
articles.content:
Ofrecido banquete con motivo del Dia del Ejercito de Vietnam 
Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia del Ejercito de Vietnam, el encargado de negocios a. i. Pham Huu Giao y el agregado militar Nguyen Quoc Viet de la embajada vietnamita en Corea ofrecieron el dia 21 un banquete en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang. 
					A la cita fueron invitados el primer viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, No Kwang Chol, generales y oficiales del Ejercito Popular de Corea y otros funcionarios junto con los representantes diplomaticos y los agregados militares de varios paises, acreditados en la RPDC.
					
					Estuvieron presentes los miembros de la Embajada de la Republica Socialista de Vietnam.
